name: rowan
text: the sign will be that this strip is awesome

name: cashprizes
text: this was my friend's desktop for quite some time.

name: huber
text: A comment left by huber was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by Overmedicated, NeoNaoNeo, Catachresis)

name: a_dude
text: Life IS Awesome. and that is the sign

name: saint
text: it's great because of your avatar. thank you for the sign.

name: giantants
text: A comment left by giantants was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by fakead, Overmedicated, VictoriaW)

name: jesler729
text: How about "Oh my gosh when is my mom getting home oh this was a bad idea why on earth did I do this I wonder how red my eyes are OH GOD THEY ARE SO RED"

name: rowboat
text: Thank you. Thank you for telling a story from that side. "Life is awesome" isn't the only sign. Not every time.

name: gazdatronik
text:
Hell yes. the one and only time I ever tried it, I was fine...until my buddies dragged me to a barbeque sandwich restaurant and I started moving from table to table every second, despite standing totally still. I was freaking out and panicking, but not for what others might think of me. I was like "I DO NOT LIKE THIS I NEED TO GO HOME AND DO LAWN CHORES GODDAMMIT" or my Grandmother who was dead would be angry.

If that is a party then it is the nazi party. Never again.

The sandwich was quite delicious.

name: jesler729
text: You are thinking of LSD

name: gazdatronik
text: I wish it was LSD, then my reaction would make more sense. But it was plain ol' weed in a bong with ice cubes. Like I said, NEVER AGAIN.

name: rowboat
text:
I would tell you to just get back on the horse. I would tell you that such a reaction is extremely rare and usually just happens the first few times, if at all. But I am reminded of a friend of mine who has tried to smoked probably no fewer than twenty times and on every single occasion had to basically be talked out of calling an ambulance.

I'm all trying to watch Miller's Crossing and he's all getting in front of me, plaintively looking into my eyes, "Robby....Robby I'm dying. I'm serious. I can feel myself dying, man." Here's a guy who can drink me under the table, but one hit of weed and he's writing up his will.

There are some people who's bodies just don't handle it well, ever. You may be one. Though, I may suggest that bong rips are not really the ideal means of initiation. If you ever get up the nerve again, try just one small hit to start with. Ease into it.

name: fineoakstructure
text:
This...this sounds just like a spinynorman story, except it didn't involve a racist stripper or homeless person in a dilapitated building or whatever Americanized Fellini-ism he interjects into every third post.

(that is, it sounded real.)

name: apocowarg
text: ~chuckles softly to himself~

name: rowboat
text: Realism ain't where the chubbs are at.

name: fineoakstructure
text:
Evidently not. You'll just have to suffer with your ~4000 chubbies, I guess.

Spinynorman is a very funny guy, of course...but I suppose I still stand by my mild criticism above. Alert the media.

name: rowboat
text:
You neglect to mention the 4000 comments it took to get those 4000 chubbies. Spinynorman probably had 4000 after, like, three.

And my comment above shouldn't be taken as an indictment of the validity of his stories. I don't really have an opinion either way. And even if they are slighty.... embellished, they make for a pretty good read a lot of the time and that's better than most people do here.

In the end, I've come to think of that Stephen Fry avatar as a reason to stop scrolling and start reading - increasingly prevalent spinynorman backlash be damned.

name: fineoakstructure
text:
I think I'm on a "chubby per post" average, as well, though still far fewer chubbies than 4000. The tears, they do come, but they are not often.

Yeah, I don't want to make it sound like I have a beef with the guy. Defintely one of those "favorite" assetbar posters that deserves all the nods. I think I posted my original comment after strolling at random through the archives, and just noticing a trend in several of spiny's longer stories (crazy/drunk friends, exceedingly unique individuals with sordid pasts that come and go in a flash, etc.), and it was starting to wear a little thin on me.

There's increasingly prevalent anti-spinynormania comments on assetbar? Really? I can't remember any. I think there was one other time last year that I called him the A-Rod of assetbar, which was supposed to be a (jokingly) negative comment, but now I don't really know what I even meant by it.

name: fineoakstructure
text:
Basically next time just try to make your comment FUNNY like spinynorman would've, rowboat.

god DAMN.

name: rowboat
text: "Increasingly prevalent" might've been a reach. Just seeing the occasional comment here and there, basically in the same vein as yours. Hell, maybe they were all yours.

name: apocowarg
text: I've come across a few that were from others but they were confined to the newer strips. So far in my third trek through the archives there's nothing but love. Up until now I suppose (though you both ended up showing the love).

name: snowman
text: This is almost always part of the experience for me, at least for a few minutes, and then it sort of gradually gives way to life being awesome.

name: kelsotimebomb
text:
It's all about the eyedrops. You gotta find a brand that gets your eyes sparkling white .

Then there are no worries.

name: snowman
text: Ooh, that is a very good point.  I never really think of that.  I always feel like something that will really work will also sting the heck out of my eyes.  Any recommendations?

name: kelsotimebomb
text:
The stuff I use is called Rohto V. It comes in a clear, round bottle with a green cap. It makes your eyes tingle in kind of a minty way (so don't use them while driving... uh.) but they clear that shit RIGHT up.

Also, "they get your eyes sparkling white" was the exact way they were described to me for the first time.

name: the_voice
text: I keep my eyedrops in the fridge. Nothing is more refreshing than a cold-ass eyewash come morning.

name: kelsotimebomb
text: I, too, have experienced cold-ass eyedrops.  But it was from leaving them in my car in the middle of winter.

name: the_voice
text: I'm a plain-old Visine Tears man at the moment, but I'll check out this Rohto V stuff. It sounds...obscure and dignified.

name: jollysaintpete
text: Rohto's are so goddamned painful. I use Opcon because it works without the pain. My friend used to have these Rohto Arctic, or some shit, they were called, I remember they had a silver lid instead of the green or blue lid the normal kind has, and the bottle said that the eyedrops produced a cooling sensation. In your eyes. My friend convinced me to try them and it's basically a lot like going temporarily blind. Actually exactly like going temporarily blind, because temporarily you go blind

name: invidious
text: Huh. My sign was the idea that if I listened hard enough I'd be able to hear what was beyond the silence .

name: hooraybacon
text: I had always been too shy to chubby and in a moment of boldness I decided that this post was worth a chubby.  It is with great shame that I report that in the moment of truth I missed chubby and hit lame instead.

name: greenkoolayd
text: you need a nap, buddy.

name: atom
text: You know, it always vaguely bugged me that Nightlife kinda broke his perfect hep cat vernacular in that last panel, but really, there's only one way to say "the sign will be that life is awesome" and that's, uh, the way he said it.  So NEVER MIND I suppose

name: radishes
text: This is a complete classic.  I love it.  I rate it an easy five.  This is one of the ones that makes you love Achewood.

name: bilingualmonkey
text:
Chubby for the gush.

What a strange sentence.

name: scott_karana
text: Chubby for having My Bloody Valentine's "Loveless" as your avatar.

name: chaesar
text:
Ray loves a compliment.

this strip rests easily in my top 10

name: mattylite
text: Totally.  That grin in panel 2 could go cat-less, all Lewis Carroll style.

name: nurdbot
text: Achewood needs the occasional stop by of Mingus, because he is one cool cat.

name: epicurus
text: The reason this is in the top rated is obviously the last three panels which are awesome. So awesome. I say that "I will give you a sign. The sign will be that [blank] is awesome". I even lean in and try to say it in italics.

name: djwhiterabbit
text:
the sign will be that your comment is awesome.

say it in italics. (^ ^,)

name: sredni
text: Yeah the way he leans in in the last strip is what makes it for me

name: pitseleh
text: I love the subtleties of Achewood humor.

name: paco
text: That is the sign

name: pohlhoud
text:
The sign will be that life is awesome.

I used that line. Let me tell you that it worked.

It worked.

name: aaron_haynes
text: I imagine Nightlife's voice being somewhere between Snoop Dogg and Ethan "Bubblegum" Tate from Futurama.

name: stuart
text: Even Nightlife's text is laid back.

name: miku224
text: This comment deserves way more chubbies.

name: heccibiggs
text: Oh, you convinced me.

name: snowman
text: Okay, I've wondered this for a long time -- what the heck is with your icon?  Where is that from?  Every time I see it, I end up staring at it for close to a minute.

name: rowboat
text:
I don't know what it's from, but I do know that it's the most fawned over icon on this whole board.

Me, I'll take the bouncing tits.

I am of low mind.

name: miku224
text:
Unfortunately, I can't tell you where I found it. I can say that I didn't make, and therefore shouldn't get all the credit.

And yes, rowboat, the assetbar community seems to enjoy it a lot more than is reasonable or healthy.

name: slab64
text:
Let's just line up all the animated icons right here in this thread.

waits for boobs

name: jollysaintpete
text: Why can't you say where you found it? Did you steal it from the government or something, what the fuck?

name: i_love_kate
text: Animated icon, reporting for duty!

name: miku224
text: No, I just forgot.

name: winkmartindale
text: This was my favorite strip for a long time, just so accurate.

name: lawbot
text: In the final frame, Nightlife looks a little like my fiance's father. Odd, but true, despite his tendency to be clean-shaven, and bare-headed.

name: chuchurocket
text: you mean your fiance's father that i boned ?

name: lawbot
text: A comment left by lawbot was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by KilroyWasHere, twohundredninety, rajib, SpinyNorman, Wulvaine, scott_335)

But nonetheless, maybe you should call him up and apologise.

name: rowboat
text: Lemme get this straight - Beef's a grown-ass cat, been chillin' with Ray since Small Times, and he ain't never bit that apple? Dang.

name: snowman
text: Yeah, that seemed weird to me too.

name: mystkmanat
text: We know from earlier strips that he's been on cocaine so I think this may have been a mistake. Maybe. I am sorry.

name: c_dizzle
text:
"So uh do I hold onto the club such as this?"
Does anyone see the beauty in Beefs nervous grammar?

name: puadxe
text: Onstad treats grammar like an expressionist treats paint

text:
holy crap, totally fucked that post and my meaning entirely, totally clicked con instead of pro, totally meant that he uses it skillfully but disregarding proper conventions

christ
it's the grass

text: I guarantee nobody noticed that.

name: overman
text: I hope he kills the ball in the next strip.

name: tellumo
text: Well, Ray has a crush on being high, but I think Nightlife might have gone so far as to open a joint checking account with it.

text: oh God, i am so sorry. i gave this it's six-hundred-and-sixty-sixth vote.

text: ohmygawd..."a great big bite of reefer"...i love this comic for oh-so many reasons, but the one in mind at the moment is the revamping of stoner slang. it needed it.
